Posts.Content: imadaughter wrote: My mom had her appt Last week and her PET and Bone Scan came back with a couple new small lesions on her pelivs but yet the report and the dr said she is still stable and they are not doing anything different.  I am curious how that can be.  She has mets to liver/bones/lungs.  They have shrunk a lot from the beginning but did not change since her last pet scan 3 months ago. Posts.Title: What is considered stable? imadaughter rkt

Posts.Content: Aug 11, 2010 10:41PM imadaughter wrote: Thanks for the replies.  I am not worried, I just figured I want to stay on top of it since everyone in my family that has had it has had the aggressive form and has been stage iv right from the start.  I am supposed to get another mammo at 35.  I give my self exams now so I am assuming I may be safe for getting an mri until I get my mammo at 35 unless I see any other changes.  I did post another topic though about the lump.  I really think it is just a boil or something that hasnt come to a head since it is on the exterior.  But if you wouldnt mind looking at my other topic in this sections called lumps....I appreciate the replies.

Posts.Title: dense breast imadaughter imadaughter

Posts.Content: imadaughter wrote: Hello everyone, I have been on the board before but it had been awhile and I could not remember my old user name so I created a new account. My mom was diagnosed with BC a year ago. She is stage IV with mets to the spine, pelvis, shoulder, liver, and lungs. She is also ER/PR - and HER2 +++.  She is currently on Taxol and Carboplatin I think.  They have had to make changes.  She also receives Herceptin once a week. She had been doing really well, but lately her tumor markers keep going up.  It is the CA 27-29 (I think that is what it is called) They were down to 46 then up to 80 then 87 now they are up to 99.  She doesn't meet with her doctor until next week, but I was wondering if this could be a sign that things are progressing. Her last PET scan still showed the lesions but most of them had shrunk some.  I know that other things can cause the rise, but she has not started any new medicine, chemo, etc for a while now.  I just like to know what I am dealing with before her so I can help her through it.  If I prepare myself first I can better handle and help my family. Thank you for any input. Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Tumor marker imadaughter imadaughter

Posts.Content: imadaughter wrote: Hello, I was just wondering on average how long a person is on chemo.  I know things change, if you dont respond you try a different one, side effects try a different one, etc but do you usually stay on chemo until you are NED?  I am sure there are a lot of different answers and it depends on the situation so this may just be a dumb question to ask anyways. MY mom has been getting Taxotere and cisplatin and herceptin for 10 months now.  She gets them every week.  I was just wondering if this is something she will just contiue to do until something changes or at what point they say okay you are good to stop for awhile.  She is stage iv mets to liver/lungs/bones as of last scan they are considering her stable Her2+ er/pr- Thanks Log in to post a reply
